Indonesian: 1. rekening (from Dutch – used in banks and hotels), 2. akun (used for all meanings of account apart from bank account)
1. setelah (also used in Malay to indicate consecutive actions), 2. sesudah, selepas

Standard Malay (Malaysian): lapangan terbang ('airfield' in Indonesian; similar to Dutch vliegveld)
Indonesian: bandar udara (loan translation of the English term, commonly abbreviated as bandara),  lapangan terbang

Standard Malay (Malaysian): pangsapuri, rumah pangsa, rumah kondo (only for 'condominium')
Indonesian: apartemen (influenced by Dutch appartement), rumah susun (rusun) (public housing for poor families), kondominium

Standard Malay (Malaysian): majlis, perhimpunan (from the root verb 'himpun' meaning 'to gather/assemble')

Indonesian: Athena (influenced by Dutch Athene or from native Greek Athina)

Standard Malay (Malaysian): makcik (also used in Riau Malay dialect in Indonesia), emak saudara, ibu saudara

Indonesian: autobiografi, otobiografi is a nonstandard spelling
otomatis (derived from Dutch pronunciation of automatisch)
